intro: Zucca commersoniana, commonly known as the Commerson's squash, is a species of flowering plant in the Cucurbitaceae family. It is native to South America, particularly Argentina and Chile, and thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant produces large, elongated fruits that can reach lengths of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are broad and lobed, with a rough texture, and it has yellowish-green flowers that bloom in the summer. The fruit is often used in traditional medicine and as a food source in local communities.
